properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Is Being Issued By Village Of Stewart Valley
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Village of Stewart Valley. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water from the Stewart Valley water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2020-06-05T16:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-05-21T06:59:42-06:00, 97A9D821-2D5C-A4E0-BD49-75C8CE99F1A6
Area: Village of Stewart Valley
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter is not over yet. Significant snowfall and strong winds expected beginning Friday afternoon. Total snowfall: 10 cm or more. Maximum wind gusts: 80 km/h or higher. Locations: Postville to Makkovik. Time span: Friday afternoon through Saturday morning. Remarks: Periods of snow will begin Friday afternoon and become heavier Friday night. Strong northwesterly winds will also develop gusting to 80 km/h or higher and cause reduced visibility in blowing snow. Conditions will improve on Saturday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-22T18:18:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T02:19:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2062080500.2020
Area: Postville - Makkovik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain over northern Manitoba today and tonight. A weather system approaching from Saskatchewan will continue to bring a mix of precipitation to northern Manitoba today. A line of freezing rain from Lynn Lake to Gillam will move north throughout the day, and will affect the Churchill region this evening. Freezing rain amounts of 5 to 10 mm are expected. Some areas in these regions may receive accumulating snow. Easterly winds gusting to 50 to 60 km/h are also forecast. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-23T01:41:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T09:42:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3701625714.2020
Area: Brochet, Tadoule Lake, Lynn Lake, Leaf Rapids, Pukatawagan, South Indian Lake and Amisk Prov. Park, Split Lake and York Landing, Thompson Thicket Portage and Pikwitonei, Nelson House, Churchill, York, Gillam, Shamattawa
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A weather system over southern BC will bring showers to the region today. Snow levels have lowered to 1200 to 1400 metres this morning and is forecast to rise to near 1700 metres this afternoon. Snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm are expected this morning over highway 3 - Paulson summit to Kootenay Pass and over the Okanagan Connector. Lesser amounts of 2 to 4 cm are possible over Allison Pass and Coquihalla Highway - Hope to Merritt. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-23T03:39:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T11:40:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3003739812.2020
Area: Highway 3 - Hope to Princeton via Allison Pass, Highway 3 - Paulson Summit to Kootenay Pass, Coquihalla Highway - Hope to Merritt, Okanagan Connector - Merritt to Kelowna
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A weather system over southern BC will bring showers to the region today and Friday. Snow level will lower to 1300 to 1500 metres tonight and rise to 1700 to 1900 metres Friday afternoon. Over highway 3 - Paulson summit to Kootenay Pass, showers will change to snow this evening with local amounts up to 10 cm near Kootenay Pass by late Friday morning. Snow will taper off to a few flurries or rain showers Friday afternoon. Over the Okanagan connector, up to 5 cm snow accumulations are possible near the summit tonight. Snow will taper off or change to rain showers Friday morning. Over the Allison Pass, showers may change to flurries near the summit this evening with possibly up to 2 cm snow accumulation tonight. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-22T19:15:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T03:16:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1765097678.2020
Area: Highway 3 - Hope to Princeton via Allison Pass, Highway 3 - Paulson Summit to Kootenay Pass, Okanagan Connector - Merritt to Kelowna
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A weather system approaching from southern Saskatchewan will bring a mix of precipitation to northern Manitoba tonight and Friday. An area of rain turning to freezing rain is expected to develop this evening in the southern Brochet, southern Tadoule , northern Lynn Lake, and northern Thompson regions and then spread into the Gillam and Shamattawa regions tonight. Depending on overnight temperatures, parts of Lynn Lake region may see some freezing rain tonight and early Friday. Freezing rain amounts of 5 to 10 mm are expected. Some areas in these regions may receive accumulating snow. Easterly winds gusting to 50 to 60 km/h are also forecast. This freezing rain will continue through Friday and may push through the Churchill area Friday night. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-22T17:50:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T01:51:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2859414632.2020
Area: Brochet, Tadoule Lake, Lynn Lake, Leaf Rapids, Pukatawagan, South Indian Lake and Amisk Prov. Park, Split Lake and York Landing, Thompson Thicket Portage and Pikwitonei, Nelson House, Gillam, Shamattawa
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: northwesterly 100 km/h. Locations: Hopedale and vicinity, Postville - Makkovik, and Cartwright to Black Tickle. Time span: overnight tonight until Saturday morning. Remarks: The strongest wind gusts will be over exposed coastal areas. Additionally, with periods of snow forecast to accompany these strong winds, poor visibilities in blowing snow can be expected at times. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-22T23:59:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T08:00:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0644051548.2020
Area: Cartwright to Black Tickle, Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Ice build-up due to freezing rain is expected or occurring. Freezing rain is expected to continue this morning. A band of freezing rain is expected to sit over northeastern Saskatchewan this morning. This freezing rain will end this afternoon when warmer air moves into the area and changes the precipitation over to rain. ### Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-22T22:29:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T10:33:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4203733422.2020
Area: Cree Lake - Key Lake, Wollaston Lake - Collins Bay, Southend - Brabant Lake - Kinoosao
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Ice build-up due to freezing rain is expected or occurring. Freezing rain is expected to begin late this evening and will persist into Friday morning. The main band of freezing rain is expected to set up between Collins Bay and Southend, with the heaviest precipitation occurring over northern portions of Reindeer Lake. Some areas may experience a period of freezing rain before the precipitation turns over to snow or ice pellets. The freezing rain should end by noon Friday. ### Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-22T19:30:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T03:31:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0334317215.2020
Area: Wollaston Lake - Collins Bay, Southend - Brabant Lake - Kinoosao
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-23T05:39:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T13:39:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2089915569.2020
Area: Cumberland County - Minas Shore, Cumberland County North and Cobequid Pass, Colchester County - Cobequid Bay, Colchester County North, Colchester County - Truro and south, Halifax County - east of Porters Lake, Pictou County, Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Richmond County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Some plants may be damaged or even destroyed by frost. Frost and freeze conditions will develop tonight as temperatures fall to near freezing. Frost will be possible again Saturday night into Sunday morning. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-23T00:40:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-22T08:41:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2518246015.2020
